scheme_name: Construction of Ideal Fish Pond Scheme in Hilly Areas
brief_description: The scheme aims to promote sustainable fish farming through cluster-based pond development. It provides 50% subsidy for pond construction and first-year inputs to eligible individuals and groups.
detailed_description: The Scheme &quot;Construction of Ideal Fish Pond Scheme in Hilly Areas&quot; was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sustainable fish production by utilizing water resources effectively in hilly regions through cluster-based pond development. Under this scheme, financial support of up to 50% of the cost is provided for the construction of ponds and first-year investments such as fish fingerlings and feed to all caste categories in hilly areas. It also includes free technical assistance, optional free training, and marketing support through departmental platforms like Uttarafish.
benefits: Individual beneficiaries: Up to ₹2,50,000/- for pond capacity up to 500 cubic meters. Committee/Group/Mahasandh/Federation/Mangal Dal: Up to ₹5,00,000/- for pond capacity up to 1,000 cubic meters. Subsidy for First-Year Inputs: 50% subsidy for purchasing fish fingerlings and feed. Technical Assistance: Free technical guidance for high-growth fish species. Optional free training in fishery operations. Marketing Support: Option to sell fish independently or via "Uttarafish", a state-supported fish marketing platform. Cluster Requirement: A minimum of 10 ponds must be constructed in one location, either by an individual or by a group. Self-Financing/Loan Provision The remaining 50% investment is to be made by the beneficiary through personal funds or bank loans. NOTE: The subsidy is paid to the beneficiary's account through DBT. Applicants can avail grants either individually or through registered groups and cooperatives, with additional funding covered through self-investment or bank loans.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant should belong to any caste category and reside in a hilly region of the state. The applicant should be involved in fish production or be interested in starting it. The applicant should have access to a reliable water supply source. The applicant should have own land or leased land for construction of fish pond. The applicant can apply individually or as part of a committee, group, cooperative, federation, or Mangal Dal. The applicant should ensure the construction of a minimum of 10 ponds at one place(either individually or jointly).

steps: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-Charge at the district level and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level. Post-application Process: Step 1: A fisheries inspector/field officer conducts a site survey and prepares a proposal in collaboration with the applicant. Step 2: The proposal is reviewed and approved by the concerned district fisheries officer. Step 3: Pond construction is carried out under the supervision of field personnel. Technical assistance is provided throughout. Step 4: On completion, based on the work completion certificate, the subsidy is released via DBT. In case of loans, subsidy is disbursed through the bank. Note: If the applicant lacks 50% of the required funds, a loan can be availed from nearby cooperative or commercial banks. Department-provided proposals are submitted to the bank for loan approval.

Registration Process: Step 1: Visit to e-Services Apuni Sarkar ( https://eservices.uk.gov.in ) and click "Sign Up" on the Citizen Login page. Step 2: Fill in the registration form with your name, email, mobile number, etc., and click Submit. Step 3: You will receive your User ID and password via SMS on your registered mobile number. Application Process: Step 1: Navigate to the Citizen Login page and enter your User ID (email or mobile) and password, complete the captcha, then click Sign In. Step 2: Once logged in, your dashboard appears. Click "Apply for New Application" or similar to begin. Step 3: Choose the Fisheries department, from the list, select the specific scheme you wish to apply for. Step 4: The portal will list mandatory documents required and upload mandatory documents, after uploading, click Submit to proceed. Step 5: Enter all required details in the form (personal, land, bank, etc.). Use Save to save progress, preview to review, or Delete Draft to reset. Step 6: Once all fields are accurately filled, click Submit. You will receive an Application ID receipt, which you can download. Track Application and Approval: Step 1: The application goes to the concerned department for review. Step 2: You can track your application status on the portal using your Application ID.

documents_required: Applicant Photo Aadhaar Card Permanent Residence Certificate Caste Certificate Khasra-Khatauni of Land (Land Ownership Document) Bank Account Details/Copy of Front Page of Bank Passbook Mobile Number Photo Of construction Site Group Registration Certificate (in case of group application) Land Availability Certificate (if land is not owned by the applicant but is accessible)
